src:
Le še ribji drobiž
V našem morju ulovljene ribe primerne le še za juhe, za gradele so premajhne. Strokovnjaki pravijo, da je glavni krivec prelov plave ribe.
02 Nov 2019, 12:46 by Janez Petkovšek



Ulova veliko, velikih rib pa bore malo. FOTO: Janez Petkovšek



V slovenskem delu Jadrana prevladuje ribji drobiž. FOTO: Janez Petkovšek



Odrasli šnjuri so redki, podmerski šnjurčki vse pogostejši. FOTO: Janez Petkovšek


Za slovenski del Jadranskega morja je značilno, da je izjemno plitvo, razen v obrežnem pasu je večinoma zamuljeno in brez skrivališč za morske organizme. Kljub temu se še pred nekaj leti ni bilo treba pritoževati nad ulovom rib in mehkužcev. Zadnje čase je opaziti izrazito več nedorasle bele in plave ribe, manj velikih primerkov pa tudi odsotnost posameznih vrst, ki jih je bilo prej v izobilju. Zato smo na Oddelku za morsko ribištvo na Zavodu za ribištvo Slovenije poskušali izvedeti, kaj je razlog za tako stanje.
Kje so velike ribe?


V slovenskem delu Jadrana prevladuje ribji drobiž. FOTO: Janez Petkovšek

Povod za vprašanja je porazna statistika ulova z nedavnega polfinala državnega prvenstva v ribolovu iz čolna s palico pri Strunjanu, ki se ga je udeležilo 22 tekmovalcev. Čeprav so v dveh dneh s petimi tekmovalnimi urami skupaj ujeli kar 1064 rib, je njihova skupna teža dosegla le 65 kg, kar pomeni, da je povprečen primerek tehtal nekaj več kot šest dekagramov. A tekmovalni ribiči že nekaj let ne glede na akvatorij, ki sega od Kopra do Izole, Strunjana, Pirana in Bernardina, ne lovijo drugega kot ribji drobiž (podmerske ribone, vse redkejše špare, vse drobnejše menole, vse manjše in redke mole), orade, kokoti in druge večje ribe pa so le naključni ulovi. Plava riba, še posebno šnjuri in skuše, pa je skoraj izginila.
134 ton rib je znašal lanski ulov slovenskih poklicnih in športnih ribičev.
Četudi naj bi se jeseni ribe intenzivno prehranjevale in bile po koncu turistične sezone zaradi zmanjšanega hrupa tudi bližje obali, se ribiči sprašujejo, kje so velike ribe. So za njihovo odsotnost odgovorne skakavke ali drugi predatorji, morda delfini, ki so se v minulih letih pojavljali v jatah, letos pa jih ne opažamo več, kar bi lahko bila posledica pomanjkanja zanje zanimivih (plavih) rib, sip in lignjev? Ali je to posledica zimskega lovljenja matičnih jat belih rib v Portoroškem zalivu z mrežami, ki ga država dovoli ob že dolgo ne več tradicionalnem izlovu cipljev? Prav tako je vse pogosteje videti mreže, ki so razpete tudi v naravnih rezervatih vsega nekaj metrov od obale oziroma celo v neposredni bližini školjčišč. Da ne govorimo o kočarjih, ki lovijo tudi bližje od 1,5 navtične milje od obale, čeprav povsod drugje velja pravilo treh milj od obale.
Glavni problem prelov


Odrasli šnjuri so redki, podmerski šnjurčki vse pogostejši. FOTO: Janez Petkovšek

Tomaž Modic iz Zavoda za ribištvo Slovenije je dejal, da natančnega razloga za opisano stanje ne pozna, ve pa, da je odsotnost velikih primerkov običajno posledica prelova. Plenilske ribe verjetno ne vplivajo toliko na posamezne populacije rib, da bi bile one razlog. V slovenskem plitvem morju brez struktur je po njegovem prepričanju od nekdaj poudarek na migratornih ribah, ki prihajajo in odhajajo ter so za njih značilne sezone, ko se pojavljajo. Problem pa je, da malo velikih odraslih primerkov opažajo tudi v sosednjih državah (Italija, Hrvaška), in zato jih ni k nam. Lahko pa je razlog tudi dokazani prelov malih pelagičnih rib v Sredozemlju in Jadranu, ki so osnovna hrana v prehranjevalni verigi.Trenutno sta sardela in sardon v programu ukrepov za izboljšanje stanja, v Sloveniji pa ju ciljno niti ne lovijo več. Žal to ne velja za sosednje države. Delfini male pelagične ribe prav tako potrebujejo in verjetno sledijo jatam, kjer te so, še pravi Modic. Opaža tudi vedno bolj bistro morje v Sloveniji celo poleti, kar se pred leti ni dogajalo. Odsotnost planktona pa je lahko znak velikih sprememb. O kočarjih je dejal, da zelo verjetno ne lovijo na prepovedanih območjih, odkar imajo na plovilih nameščene naprave za sledenje in jim lahko sledi tako rekoč vsak, ki ima mobilni telefon. Zato je morsko dno do meje 1,5 Nm po njegovem varno pred kočarjenjem.StatistikaČe so vsi ribiči še leta 2009 skupaj ulovili 952 ton rib in drugih morskih organizmov, so jih lani le še 134. Če so sardel in sardonov leta 2009 ujeli kar 447 ton, so jih lani le še poldrugo tono. Molov so leta 2012 ulovili rekordnih 85 ton, lani le 29. Največ orad so ulovili leta 2015 (29 ton), lani samo dobrih 15. Številke ne presenečajo, saj ladji Riba I in II ne lovita več od leta 2011, zaposlenih poklicnih ribičev pa je iz leta v leto manj – predlani le še 100. Upada celo število letnih dovoljenj za rekreativne in športne ribiče – predlani jih je bilo 854, lani 791. Enako njihov ocenjeni ulov (manj kot pol jih vrne izpolnjeno statistiko). Ta je bil leta 2017 dobrih 10 ton, lani le še devet.
text:
Only fish
In our sea, the fish caught are only suitable for soups, for grilled fish are too small. Experts say the main culprit is blue fish overfishing.
02 Nov 2019, 12:46 by Janez Petkovsek



She catches a lot and big fish fight a little. PHOTO: Janez Petkovsek



In the Slovenian part of the Adriatic, fish crust predominates. PHOTO: Janez Petkovsek



Adult snipes are rare, submerged snipes are becoming more common. PHOTO: Janez Petkovsek


The Slovenian part of the Adriatic Sea is characterized by being extremely shallow, except in the coastal zone it is mostly muddy and with no hiding places for marine organisms. Nevertheless, a few years ago, there was no need to complain about catching fish and molluscs. Recently, there have been markedly more juvenile white and blue fish, fewer large specimens, and the absence of individual species previously abundant. That is why we tried to find out at the Department of Marine Fisheries at the Fisheries Research Institute of Slovenia what is the reason for this situation.
Where are the big fish?


In the Slovenian part of the Adriatic, fish crust predominates. PHOTO: Janez Petkovsek

The reason for the questions is the devastating catch statistics from the recent semi-finals of the national pole-and-line fishing championship at Strunjan, which was attended by 22 competitors. Although they caught as many as 1064 fish in two days with five race hours, their total weight reached only 65 kg, meaning that the average specimen weighed just over six decagrams. But competing fishermen for several years, regardless of the waters extending from Koper to Izola, Strunjan, Piran and Bernardin, do not fish other than finches (submerged ribs, rarer spars, ever smaller mole, ever smaller and rare whiting), gilthead , coyotes and other large fish are only incidental catches. The blue fish, especially the schnitzels and the mackerel, are almost gone.
134 tons of fish were caught by Slovenian professional and sport fishermen last year.
Even though fish are expected to feed intensively in the fall and be closer to shore after the end of the tourist season, fishermen are wondering where the big fish are. Are the locusts or other predators responsible for their absence, perhaps dolphins, which have appeared in flocks in recent years, but are no longer observed this year, which could be the result of the lack of interesting (blue) fish, cuttlefish and squid? Is it the result of winter fishing for mother flocks of whitefish in the Gulf of Portorož, which the country allows in the long-standing traditional fishing of the shoe? It is also increasingly common to see nets that are also spread out in nature reserves only a few meters from the coast or even in close proximity to shells. Not to mention huts that also fish closer than 1.5 nautical miles offshore, though the rule of three miles offshore applies everywhere else.
The main problem of overfishing


Adult snipes are rare, submerged snipes are becoming more common. PHOTO: Janez Petkovsek

Tomaz Modic of the Slovenian Fisheries Institute said that he did not know the exact reason for the described situation, but he knew that the absence of large specimens was usually due to overfishing. Predatory fish are unlikely to have an impact on individual fish populations for that reason. According to him, in the Slovenian shallow sea without structures, the emphasis has always been on migratory fish coming and going and characterized by the seasons when they occur. The problem is, however, that few large adult specimens are also observed in neighboring countries (Italy, Croatia), and therefore are not available to us. It may also be a reason for the proven overfishing of small pelagic fish in the Mediterranean and Adriatic, which are the staple foods in the food chain. Currently, anchovies and anchovies are in the program of measures to improve the situation and are no longer being targeted in Slovenia. Unfortunately, this does not apply to neighboring countries. Dolphins also need small pelagic fish and probably follow the flocks where they are, Modic says. He also observes the increasingly clear sea in Slovenia even in the summer, which did not happen years ago. However, the absence of plankton can be a sign of major changes. He said the hikers were very likely to not hunt in the forbidden areas since they had tracking devices installed on the vessels and could be followed by virtually anyone with a mobile phone. That is why the seafloor is up to the limit of 1.5 Nm after its safety from fishing. StatisticIf all fishermen caught 952 tonnes of fish and other marine organisms in 2009, there were only 134. Last year, as many as 447 caught anchovies and anchovies in 2009. tons, last year they were only half a ton. Moths caught a record 85 tonnes in 2012, only 29. Last year, the largest number of fishery was caught in 2015 (29 tonnes), only a good 15 last year. The numbers are not surprising since Fish I and II are no longer fishing since 2011, and professional fishermen are employed The number of annual permits for recreational and sport fishermen decreased - 854, 791 last year. The same is their estimated catch (less than half return the completed statistics). This one was a good 10 tons in 2017, just nine more last year.
